column2: Fortis Healthcare Ltd is looking for Infection Control Nurse to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     An Infection Control Nurse is a specialized healthcare professional who is responsible for preventing and controlling the spread of infections within healthcare settings     They play a crucial role in ensuring patient safety and reducing the risk of healthcare-associated infections     Here are some key responsibilities of an Infection Control Nurse:Developing and implementing infection control policies and procedures: Infection Control Nurses work closely with healthcare administrators, physicians, and other healthcare workers to develop comprehensive infection control policies and protocols     They ensure that these policies comply with local, state, and federal regulations and are based on current evidence-based practices     Monitoring infection control practices: Infection Control Nurses conduct regular surveillance to monitor healthcare-associated infections and identify any trends or outbreaks     They review patient records, laboratory reports, and other relevant data to track infections and evaluate the effectiveness of prevention strategies     Educating healthcare staff: Infection Control Nurses provide ongoing education and training to healthcare workers regarding infection control measures, including hand hygiene, personal protective equipment (PPE) usage, proper sterilization and disinfection techniques, and isolation precautions     They also keep staff updated on new developments and guidelines in infection control     Implementing and evaluating infection prevention measures: Infection Control Nurses are responsible for ensuring that proper infection control measures are implemented throughout the healthcare facility     This includes monitoring hand hygiene compliance, environmental cleaning and disinfection practices, proper handling and disposal of infectious waste, and adherence to standard precautions and transmission-based precautions     Investigating outbreaks and incidents: Infection Control Nurses conduct thorough investigations when there are outbreaks or incidents of healthcare-associated infections     They collaborate with other healthcare professionals to identify the source of the infection, implement appropriate control measures, and prevent further spread
column11: Infection Control Nurse
column19: Kolkata, Mumbai, New Delhi, Hyderabad, Pune, Chennai, Bengaluru
column20: Kolkata, Mumbai, New Delhi, Hyderabad, Pune, Chennai, Bengaluru

column2: Fortis Healthcare Ltd  is looking for Senior Fellow Critical Care  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey    Patient Care: Provide expert medical care and management to critically ill patients in the ICU     Diagnose and treat a wide range of medical conditions, including respiratory failure, sepsis, cardiac emergencies, organ failure, and post-surgical complications     Medical Assessment: Conduct thorough assessments of patients' medical histories, physical examinations, and diagnostic test results to formulate accurate diagnoses and treatment plans     Treatment Planning: Develop and implement individualized treatment plans for critically ill patients, including prescribing appropriate medications, monitoring interventions, and life support measures     Procedures: Perform and supervise various medical procedures, including intubation, ventilator management, central line placements, arterial lines, and other invasive procedures     Multidisciplinary Collaboration: Work closely with a team of healthcare professionals, including nurses, respiratory therapists, pharmacists, nutritionists, and other specialists, to ensure seamless and comprehensive patient care     Emergency Response: Provide leadership and expertise in emergency situations, responding promptly to code blue or rapid response events and making critical decisions under pressure     Family Communication: Communicate effectively with patients' families, providing updates on patients' conditions, treatment plans, and prognosis in a compassionate and empathetic manner     Teaching and Education: Contribute to the education and training of medical students, residents, and other healthcare professionals     Stay current with the latest advancements in critical care medicine and participate in continuous medical education (CME) activities     Quality Improvement: Participate in quality improvement initiatives, research activities, and clinical audits to enhance patient outcomes and advance the field of critical care medicine     Leadership and Administration: Take on leadership roles within the ICU, contribute to policy development, and collaborate with hospital administration to optimize patient care and resource allocation
